content: the leftover scrunchie by jay show me your scrunchies on instagram using the hashtag #theleftoverscrunchie march 2021 ©jayknits for personal use only instagram @jay_knits you will need 30-60m of your yarn of choice - note this pattern is designed for use with dk yarn but you can combine yarns to make the equivalent such as 2 strands of fingering weight us 7/4 5mm in a 16 /40cm circular needle or us 7/4 5mm in a single pointed needle tapestry needle hair elastic stitch marker gauge 4 x4 22sts x 24 row using us 7/4 5mm in the round in stockinette the gauge doesn t matter all too much for this pattern so don t fret if you don t get the right gauge especially the row gauge since you ll be knitting to a certain length construction cast on 90 stitches and join in the round ensuring your stitches are not twisted feel free to add a stitch marker but it is not necessary knit stockinette in the round until the length of the tube is about 7 5-8 cm then loosely bind off but leave enough thread to stitch up the scrunchie about 40cm or 16 to make seaming easier you can block the piece according to the yarn type but i find it s not needed it s ok to leave your yarn tails long as we will tuck them into the scrunchie as we finish it finishing you will now be left with a wide tube take this tube turn it wrong side out and put your hair elastic over it i find it helpful to put around something skinny that stretches the hair elastic slightly if you re not using something inside use split ring stitch markers to hold the sides together fold over the edges slightly so the stockinette side is facing you and begin stitching the two sides together i like use the mattress stitch going through a stockinette v on each side take care not to miss any stitches when you get near the end take your yarn ends and stuff them into the scrunchie when you ve gone all the way around weave the end in cut any remaining yarn and you are done march 2021 ©jayknits for personal use only instagram @jay_knits
